data.title: Jordan John — Tower of Power
data.text:
Jordan John

Lead vocalist & multi-instrumental sensation Jordan John is a more powerful, polished & accomplished musician than many players twice his age. Adept on drums, keyboards, guitar and bass, he is a uniquely diverse & refined sonic embodiment of sheer talent & pure artistry.

Be it performing in front of 20,000 + as a lead singing, guitar wielding frontman opening for The Queen of Soul, Miss Aretha Franklin (at her personal request), jamming at age 16 on drums with the artist formerly known as Prince, performing as a featured lead vocalist & guitarist for 16x Grammy Award Winning Producer & Hitmaker David Foster or appearing as the bassist for famed Canadian rock trio, Wide Mouth Mason, Jordan’s talent & energy excites & delights spectators as well as his industry peers and musical luminaries all over the globe.

Garnering praise from the who’s who of the music industry such as world renown producer Kenny “Babyface” Edmonds, David Foster, Bob Ezrin, Steve Jordan, Keith Richards, Robbie Robertson, you may begin to register the proper amount of astonishment his musicality can command.

In addition to his work as a lead singing frontman for his own band [ featuring Jordan’s father, legendary Rock ’n Roll Hall of Fame bassist Prakash John ] throughout North America as well as overseas in Europe & Asia, Jordan’s gifted voice and diverse multi-instrumental ability have allowed him to perform & record at the highest level on drums, guitar, bass, B3 Hammond organ & clavinet for the following Canadian, American & U.K. artists

Jeff Healey, David Foster, Burton Cummings, Martin Short, Bob Ezrin, Lucky Peterson, Matt Schofield, Ronnie Spector, Pinetop Perkins, The Trailer Park Boys, Johnny Reid, Colin James, Wide Mouth Mason, Elise LeGrow and Canada’s Premier Rhythm 'n Blues band ‘The Lincolns’ to name but a few.

Now as the lead vocalist for the iconic American Soul & Rhythm 'n Blues band TOWER OF POWER, Jordan’s refreshing interpretations of T.O.P.’s soulful and classic original repertoire are sure to captivate & amaze both avid & casual fans of music well into the next decade and beyond!
